jobDescription: Job Responsibilities:Analyzing data and producing reports using spreadsheets and databasesAssisting with research and marketing projectsExperience Desired:Experience with Excel and AccessKnowledge of database/statistical analysis language (SQL or SAS)Excellent communication skillsWillingness and aptitude for detail workQualifications:Interest in an actuarial careerWorking toward Bachelors in Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Economics, or related fieldWorking toward successful completion of one or more Society of Actuaries examsKnowledge or training in computer programming languageStrong organizational skillsCollege GPA of 3.5 or more (3.5+) Applicants must be presently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. The Seattle Health Practice does not sponsor individuals for the purpose of obtaining or maintaining H-1B, O-1, or other nonimmigrant work authorizing status for this position.
